Reviews.Title: “Well located for midtown”
Reviews.Author: Colmfarl
Reviews.Content: Minutes walk from Time Square and the Theatre district. Staff were very accommodating and did all they could to assist. Naturally, the rooms are small but not so small that you can't open a door fully (some in midtown are like that!). Great place to spend a couple of nights if this area of town is your destination. I'd recommend getting out of there and heading up-town or upper west-side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Good staff”
Reviews.Author: JWassmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a friend's 30th birthday weekend in the city. The location was great! It was just a few blocks from Penn Station so we could easlily walk to and from the train station. Rooms were a little small but other than that we had a great time. Great price and location for a short weekend in the city with friends. Maria at the hotel bar was great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic area, great staff and clean room”
Reviews.Author: Renbob
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and upon checking in we were handed some delicious cookies. Once stepping into the room it was a little 'cosy' but we expected that from a hotel in New York. The room was very clean, including the bathroom. The lifts took forever but I think they were having problems with them. We ordered room service and it was very nice and not too pricey. The only issue we had was the room charges for using the phone. I called my family in Australia and spoke for approximately 15 mins and was charged $180!! When speaking to staff regarding this they kindly took $60 off. Also we accidentally dialed a couple of wrong numbers trying to get through to Aus and each time they cost $15 each and again the staff kindly took that off the bill too. We learnt our lesson to only use phone cards in New York (not a hotel issue). The fridge in the room never seem to get cold enough and there was a random tapping in the corner of our room (possibly from pipes). Overall the staff were friendly, hotel was clean and a fantastic location! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very RUDE staff”
Reviews.Author: liban0214
Reviews.Content: I was going to book a room at this hotel. But since the front desk staff member by the name of Denis kept hanging up the phone on me because I requested to speak to his manager, I will not be wasting my time or money there. I lodged a complaint with Hilton Honors, let's see how long it will take for them to respond!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: mumajb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were meeting up with other friends to holiday in the USA after 3 nights in New York. It was their choice as very central and reasonable price. Nothing fancy but very comfortable bed, friendly staff and good restaurant when you arrived shattered after long journey. We asked for room above 10th floor and got one on the 21st floor with great views . Enjoyed the ease of walking to Maceys, Empire State building and ~Broadway. Lots of places to eat nearby and very efficient Reception/foyer staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property-perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: consultbrc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this property for our yearly sojourn to Toy Fair-perfect location, walking distance down 36th. Area prices had increased, told due to improved economy, so we shopped around. Our "nameless" not-as-nice hotel where we were regulars didn't compare! Checked rates, read reviews, took the jump. Nice landing here!! Warm cookies, walking distance to our usual eateries, clean, friendly. We were on 12th floor, typical small queen bed room, large bathroom(so nice!!). Workout room looked decent, restaurant/bar on 1st floor. Only negatives were size(small) and number(2) of elevators for a building this size, which housekeeping shares, and error in final room billing(overcharged room rate). Thankfully I had booked direct, so no issue straightening it out. Just pay attention. Also had problem finding my Hilton Honors member # in their system. No biggie. So, if you're headed for anything near Convention Center/Times Square/Midtown, this is a winner. We must have had a more recently renovated room-no issues like other posters. Perfect mid-level hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very tight quarters - needs some up-keep”
Reviews.Author: shakeitsgreat
Reviews.Content: I realize that New York City has a different set of expectations when it comes to hotels - most are small, feature tiny elevators and aging facades, but a little up-keep can go a long way. The Doubletree on 36th suffers from the same afflictions of most aging buildings in Manhattan - tiny rooms, decades of layers paint, noisy elevators and narrow hallways. I am not saying this was a "bad" hotel - I mean the location is very central to all the happenings of Times Square, Madison Square Garden and the rest of Midtown, but I feel like for the money, the management could spend a little more money on the small things, like updating the bathrooms and brightening up the paint to give the hotel a little more visual appeal that is expected with a mid-level hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful, but next time I think I'll spend the extra $30/might for the full-service Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: hosp7
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sisters stayed here for my 40th birthday as a present and what a place to stay it was an excellent location right on times square and centrally located for everything 3 ladies need ie: shopping and theatre not forgetting the food the suite itself was spotless and could not fault one person from the fairy who cleaned our room to the bar tender who mixed us vodka and sprite to the lovely people who assisted us with breakfast I would like to thank each and everyone of them for a memorable stay and hope to see them soon I would recommend this as an experience you will never forget and the best place to stay to enjoy it many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service at the Double Tree!”
Reviews.Author: JeanyBL
Reviews.Content: I recently went to NYC for the first time and stayed at this great hotel. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay not just comfortable but amazing! Our first morning there we thought for sure we would need to hail 2 cabs due to there being 5 of us. While we were getting "organized" to head out the doorman suggested we take the "limo out front.". Best advise ever! It was cheaper than 2 cabs and our driver picked us up and dropped us off all throughout the city all 4 days! Although the rooms are a bit small, they make up for it with the most comfortable pillow top mattress you will ever sleep on! Also, they have a great restaurant on the first floor (reasonably priced with a friendly staff). We actually got to have a hot breakfast consisting of french toast and scrambled eggs before heading out for the day instead of the usual continental breakfast of cereal and milk. Also, its location is centrally located if you plan to walk to Times Square or Macy's! My next trip I'll definitely be staying here! What an amazing staff and great hotel! Thanks DoubleTree!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanika l
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time the staff at front desk was wonderful and the bar, as many times i walked out my room seen the housekeeper they never spoke or anything. the hotel is surrounded by lots of places to go i will going another time soon thanks for your hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Service was Brutal”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: I could not get foam pillows for 2 days. I literally called them 5 or 6 times over 2 days. TV did not work. Asked several times to fix it. Sound in and out. Took them till the second day to show up. Could not shut TV off. Everytime I hit off it kept coming back on. I got a huge splinter in my arm while typing at the desk. He desk and furniture is old and has wood shards hanging on them. Terrible stay. Truly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Rose048
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 2 Daughters ages 13 and 20. We had such a good time , hassle free. The beds are out of this world and very hard to leave behind.Hotel is just a couple of blocks away from Penn Station so perfect for the transfers to and from the Airports, Port Authority bus terminal and times square also a couple a blocks away.... absolutely perfect location and really quiet at night. Never heard a thing.we stayed in Fitzpatrick s Hotel in Manhattan before and the noise from the streets was constant, all night so this hotel is highly recommended Rose,Kailin and Sophie x

Reviews.Title: “Look carefully at your bank statements!”
Reviews.Author: Jill047
Reviews.Content: I was going to write a good review regarding this hotel (as stated, now the Doubletree Hilton). Having booked two rooms for my daughter and her 7 friends we paid upfront as none of the girls had a credit card. They all enjoyed their stay and found the rooms comfortable if not a little cramped with very little closet space and drawers for 4 people in each room, but they were hardly in the rooms. Bills were delivered to their rooms on their final day stating zero to pay. My daughter has now been home a week. I have just looked at my bank statement and have found that the hotel have charged me another Â£688 even though I paid in full a month ago. Shame on you Hilton! What a let down!

Reviews.Title: “hotel 36 IS NOW THE HILTON DOUBLETREE HOTEL !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pauline b
Reviews.Content: I always give honest reviews believing thats what tripadvisor is all about so what you read is exactly how it was. We went to new york for our wedding anniversary and booked this hotel from reading reviews the location,and the price!!! Please remember that rooms in new york are SMALL that is a fact off life am afraid,if you want a big room you will pay BIG dollers for it. When we arrived we were told that we were on the 19th floor we went to look at the room before checking in and found that kingsize bed, fridge, safe, bathroom were all fine. BUT the view from our window was bad !!! This is not the hotels fault, but we had come a long way from the other side of the pond as they say. when we went back to reception we were offered a room on the 26th floor with a view of the empire state building, the hudson river, and the new hope towers!!! the views were fantastic and at night when lying in bed looking at the empire state building all lit up thats what makes it for me. Now to the room which is ideal for one person as it was small. But for two it was a bit of a squeeze to say the least. and there was no fridge We went on the understanding that we intended to see as much off New York as we could so the room was only for changing in, sleeping in, and showering in that was all. If you go with that in mind then the rooms are fine. They are cleaned every day ,the huge towels are wonderful and always plenty of them,a good size bathroom and shower with shampoo, conditioners,and body lotions as standard also a hairdryer iron and ironing board are supplied Trying to put up the ironing board in a room this size is something else!!! but we managed and even seen the funny side of it. Now to the hotel staff i can only comment on the ones that i came into contact with so here goes JEFFERY the guy on the front desk was first class!!! so very helpful and with our upgrade which he sorted out personally made our stay in new york this guy is a credit to the Hilton group. thank you so much for all that you did for us. HAMZA the bell boy with the largest smile we have ever seen, nothing was to much trouble to him. MATHEW the I.T. guy who fixed my laptop as well as my mobile phone so i could email home. We never ate in the restaurant so i dont know what the food was like (never had time, to much to see) We did not find the lifts slow as stated in other reviews,we found the gym was very good down stairs. the bars in the hotel were ok and the staff pleasant. Over all this hotel is in a great location you can walk to all the main attractions easly A small bit of advice when in times square go to JIMMYS CORNER BAR !!!!!! This is the best bar you will find in new york, its not a plastic pub,it is a REAL old fashioned new york bar!!!! with great beer and wonderful staff who tell it as it is. One last thing the subway is easy to use and to get a round fast and very cheap but we only used it through the day not at night who ever you are i hope my review has been of some help to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Unique224
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my trip to NY and had to write a review while it is fresh in my mind!! The hotel was great. Yes the room was small but our double beds was large and comfy!!! The bathroom was a nice walk in shower with a large vanity area. Our room was always clean when we got back. The staff was great and helpful and always had a smile on there faces!! Whenever we asked for their delicious cookie they never hesitated to give us one. They were so good :). The location was wonderful close to times square but away from all the noise! Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms even for NYC - Awful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: chopsockey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last May (when it was a Wyndham hotel) for a week while in town for a convention at the Javits. The location was great and was a huge reason for selecting the hotel. All in all the hotel was fine. Staff was nice, I felt safe walking around alone, the hotel was clean and fairly updated. My big complaint was the size of the room and bathroom. They were SO small even compared to NYC standards (I stay here for a week every year). Other hotels in NYC can be smaller as well but this was exceptional. When we first arrived into our room we asked if we could be switched to a different room. Other friends in the same hotel had slightly bigger rooms. The issue is that the hotel is sort of shaped like a squared "C". The long hall of rooms (off the elevator) were a bit roomier but ours was around the corner on the ends. Not only was the room tiny but the bathroom was ridiculous. The sink was a tiny little triangle counter with a vessel sink. Because we were in the back corner (room #310 i think) a large chunk of our bathroom was cut out. (hard to explain). The sink area was so small that the faucet didn't event fit with the sink. Faucet was pushed back in the corner so much that if you didn't turn the faucet on full power, the water would miss the basin altogether. However if you turned it on all the way, it splashed all over the sides and all over the mirror. It was frustrating. The shower was a good size though. However the position of the door and faucet was annoying. You had to go into the shower to turn it on and there wasn't really a way to turn it on without getting wet. So no warming up the water first before stepping in. Our room was also pretty tiny for two co-workers. Luckily we are friends but otherwise it would have been too cramped. We had nowhere to put our suitcases and were tripping over ourselves daily. Again, our friends room had a little entry way area to put suitcases but our room did not. I think we just had the bad rooms. My friends in a room along the main hall had a normal bathroom and had no complaints. So perhaps that was our problem. We were originally in #710 and asked to be moved and they just moved us a few floors lower to the same room configuration. Not really a big help. We complained again but they insisted all the rooms were the same. Having gone into our friend's room, we knew that was not the case. I would consider staying here again but ONLY if they could assure me that I would be in a room along the main hallway not the ends. Avoid these at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish hotel dont bother”
Reviews.Author: cara g
Reviews.Content: we arrived 6th of feb 2012 hoping to find the hotel which looked like the photos on the website .... yes the reception was as photographed, but the first room we were shown you couldn't swing a cat in we were staying for five days so did have two suitcases but there was nowhere to even put your case.............the second room wasnt much better.....................the third room was a twin double so at least there was room for luggage ect ,the rooms were clean but very dated in need of painted desperately the carpets were very worn . we go away often and have stayedin lots of hotels i didnt pick the cheapeast at Â£110 a night room only !!!!would expect better we were offered a free breakfast for the inconvtnience and that sumed up the whole hotel staff were lazy the plates were dirty and the so called breakfast was in hot plates and looked like it had been there for hours!!!!! glad we hadnt paid for it. the porters were very polite but the receptionist was not helpful and all he kept saying about our complaint about the rooms was "what do you expect this is new york"!!!! my reply was he getting paid $150 a day and whether he would have used his hard earned wages to stay there??? i have never put anything on trip advisor before but had booked this for my bpartners 40th birthday so wasnt impressed. this was an ok location although try and pick a hotel nearer times square or on broadway as this hotel is a good 10-15 mins walk to times square this hotel although clean was not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great location, first rate service”
Reviews.Author: flyeroli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a five night business trip to the City and stayed at Hotel 36 (Doubletree) based on price and reviews we read on this site and Bookin.com. We had a wonderful stay and found the hotel not only in a tremendous location but run by a young energetic, thoughtful and eager to please staff. Despite the fact that their computer system went down the blink for two days and the business area and computer were not working and that staff had to open all doors everyone (guests and staff) adjusted dealt with the inconvenience professionally and in a timely manner and we did not hear one complaint. We booked a room with a king bed that was very clean with nice modern bathroom and great shower but exceptionally small. THey allowed us to switch the next day to a double on the same floor (making for an easy move). The new room was larger with more drawer space and a small fridge. They have a restaurant and serve a buffet breakfast that looked delicious but was not included. sThe bar in the lounge had a very pleasant bartender who made the early evening very pleasant with a generous pour. There is also a pretty good fitness room in the basement with two treadmills and two ellipticals and some free weights, the cardio equipment have installed tvs. A very pleasant stay at a most reasonable price we will absolutely return. As we were working at the Javits Center location was perfect an easy four block walk downhill to boot. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, but noisy & staff AWFUL.”
Reviews.Author: tarodumpling
Reviews.Content: I would have rated this hotel much higher - the location is perfect and I have no complaints with their comfortable rooms - but the staff need to improve ASAP. I booked an overnight stay for Jan 1. At 3 am on Jan 2nd, someone slips an "express checkout" receipt under my door. Ok. Then at 9 am, I'm awoken by loud banging on my door and seconds later, I hear the person outside trying to open my door with a keycard. I jump out of bed to tell her we are checking out by noon (as the checkout rules allow) and she goes away. I try to go back to sleep for another hour or so, but how can I after being so rudely interrupted? There's also a lot of loud banging sounds out in the hallway. As if this wasn't enough, I'm disturbed yet AGAIN at 11 am by ANOTHER staff about my checkout time, definitely a manager this time. We had planned to leave by noon and we did, as we are respectful guests no matter where we are and never have trouble following reasonable hotel policies. Our checkout time stated BEFORE NOON. If you want to know what time I'm checking out, why didn't you ask when I checked in, & then let your floor staff know!? I was made to feel as if they already had my money, I've spent the night, now get out. The rude interruptions were so unacceptable, they bordered on thuggish! And then a few days after I get back, I check my bank statements and find a pending charge from the hotel, which I find out is a temporary charge for "incidentals." The front desk person who checked us in said nothing about this charge. Although it has been removed (took one week after my stay,) again I did not appreciate the unpleasant surprise of seeing a $50 charge when I thought I had paid up the bill. Not to mention the inconvenience of having to call the hotel and find out what the charge is for. It doesn't matter that the hotel is in transition. I would have been more forgiving if the appearance of the hotel was less attractive, or some services were out of order, but for a hotel that used to be Wyndham Garden, there's no excuse for the staff being so unprofessional. Stay here for the convenience, stay away if you wish to avoid a service nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Now called - Double Tree Hilton”
Reviews.Author: nine877
Reviews.Content: If like us you are one of the people who booked this hotel last year, you may not know that the hotel is currently in a state of transition. In short it has changed ownership from the previous owners when it was known as 'Wyndham Gardens', to interim name of 'Hotel 36', and then finally to relaunch as 'Hilton Double Tree'. We stayed at the hotel over the last six nights and during that short time we stayed in their best room '2608'. This is on the top '26th' floor and the views were truly spectacular. When sitting on the king size bed we had clear views of the empire state building close by, the illuminated New Yorker hotel, and then the freedom tower in the distance. At night the view over the city was stunning, plus sunset again staggering. Get this room and you won't regret it. During our six night stay the staff have worked day and night without disturbing guests to transorm the hotel into the Hilton brand. Well done to them and the especially the front of house guys who were very helpful. Some have complained about the room sizes which aren't huge, but rather compact. We stiil had plenty room. As for breakfast, this was provided free as continental style. Again no problem with this. Also the hotel gave free wifi access which together with the breakfast, saved a few dollars. Location wise this hotel is bang on the money for all that Times Sqqaure has to offer and if your a sports fan Madison Square Garden is 2 blocks away. Whilst there check out 'Nick & Steffs' steak house for arguably the best food and service we've ever had from a restaurant (do try the steak cut chips!!). Anyhow, back to the hotel. The lifts are fast but during busy times you can be waiting a few minutes for the next one. Apart from this we have no complaints at all, and if your a traveller on a budget who wants to be in the middle of the action - choose this one - but remember to get a room on the front and close to the top if you want to enjoy the city view. Room 2608 is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJaneC69
Reviews.Content: Stayed over New Year 2011/2012 and they were full. What a time to decide to do renovations to the hotel! The restaurants, gym, roof terrance were all closed. All very inconvenient and did hear alot of the guests complaining. The rooms are very small for 4 people, and in our room one of the double beds was pushed up against the wall so you had to climb across the bed to get into it. Also there is no where to put luggage within the room. Did ask to be moved to a larger room but were told we were in one of their biggest rooms!!! Would be ok for 2 people, but a real squash for 4. Staff friendly, but the best part about the hotel is its location. Between 8th and 9th Street, on West 36th so really great area, 5 min walk to Madison Sq garden and about 8 mins to Times Square so easy to walk to most of the tourist spots. Also we walked down to the HighLine which is just off 10th Street which is really worth a look. Have been to NYC many times and this is the cheapest hotel we have stayed in, but it could do with being cheaper for the size of the rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “its a shocker”
Reviews.Author: sarah w
Reviews.Content: Possibly because the hotel is between brands - but mostly because they had not advised us that they were in fact between brands so. We had booked 3 nights a the Wyndham Gardens Hotel - fully expecting a full service hotel, with complimentary breakfast and what we got to was chaotic. The hotel was/is being refurbished, the rooms are T I N Y with one of the beds being so close to the airconditioner it might as well have been attached to the airconditioner. I was absolutely apauled. All credit to to the font of house staff, when I absolutely insisted that they find us alternative accommodation - they did after almost an hour and a half on the phone to other hotels in New York. It may well be fantastic when the refub is complete - for now, make another choice.

Reviews.Title: “the good and bad”
Reviews.Author: chamad
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel as part of a 2 week trip over christmas. the hotel was basic but was handy for getting about. breakfast was not very good, self service and not much choice. the really bad part was, we left our passports in the safe when we left as was catching a train to new orleans, to pick up a cruise, we realised what we had done after we had left new york, we then phoned the hotel to get them to check the safe in the room, the manager said he would and that he would phone us back. after waiting and waiting for the phone call we decided to phone them back to be told that the manager had left and that they would check in the morning. so as soon as we were up we phoned the hotel again to be told that the manager would phone us as soon as he got in, but after several expensive phone calls they said that there was nothing in the safe. I found them very unhelpful and felt that the manager was at fault. I would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: MARILOU R
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again when we come back to New York City. The staff were all very courteous and pleasant and would walk that extra mile to help you. We arrived early and they found a way to check us in, enabling us to get an early start on our exploring the city. The hot breakfast was great! Free internet access was indeed an added bonus, even had a printer to print your boarding passes and such. Thanks for making our New York stay hassle-free accommodation-wise!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in between identities, and as such is average for now.”
Reviews.Author: JustinW27
Reviews.Content: Hotel 36 was part of one chain of properties and soon will be a part of another. For now they are in a sort of limbo - down to generic black and white all-text name tags, etc. the place overall felt like that... Like they were unsure of who they were at this time. For now, the results were average. Enjoyed the free breakfast, but they were understaffed and always running out of things. Liked the updated bathrooms, but 2 of 3 seen had mold in the showers, and the third suffers from a leaky shower door that resulted in lots of water on the bathroom floor. In trying to sort our room reservation details, one front desk person hid behind policies and such, while another smoothly resolved issues and was generally helpful. Regardless, beware the evelators, as the two small ones labor mightily to service the hotel's 26 floors. Long waits result. Once this place gets an indentity and sense of self, I thinkHotel 36 will be a fine proposition. For now they seem mid pack in a crowded field of lodging opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay overall”
Reviews.Author: lovebags
Reviews.Content: Very well kept and clean room, excellent bathroom and good hot water pressure. Had a room fairly high up with a good view of the New Yorker building. Relatively quiet with little street or hotel noise. Air con unit kept the room cool and personal safe was good to keep valuables safe during the day. Friendly staff. A few blocks from subway and 15min walk to Times Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Asweetsuprise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel SUPER last minute to stay over after a rangers game. We got an awesome deal online so all I could hope for was that it was decent after reading other great reviews that all seemed to be good. The hotel was spotless clean and beds REALLY comfy! that is very important and it had a very modern bathroom. Also there was a free breakfast which included sausage egg and cheese sandwiches, suasage and bacon, french toast, fruit, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt etc. we were both surprised and thought that the breakfast would be much less than that. The only unpleasant thing about our stay was that our in room coffee maker was broken...other than that we would definitely and do plan to stay here again! Btw awesome walking distance to MSG if you are going in for a game :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic amenities in convenient location. (windows that open a plus)”
Reviews.Author: oceanseekerDC
Reviews.Content: Convenient walk from Penn Station- good location if desiring to be that area. Overall average for NY hotels in this price range. Included breakfast was good since it included yogurts and juices to grab to go, not requiring a sit down buffet when you need to get on with your day for business or sight seeing. Check in /out process was efficient. Rooms were average to fair size for NY, bathrooms well laid out to utilize the space efficiently and more sizable than many in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: ppiittyy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. NY is a walking city and the hotel's location give you the chance of being close to many attractions. It is clean. The free wi-fi in your room is excellent. Rooms come with free breakfast which I think they should really try to increase the quality of it. One bad issue for this hotel is its elevators. You should really spend time to catch an elevator. It is better to upgrade it. The staff were polite. It also has a very small gym. Over all with an exception of the week end price it really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, definately great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Judith C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after one day of being at a hotel closer to the heart of Times Square. I am sooo glad we switch to Hotel 36. Hotel 36 was sold out the first night we stayed in New York. The staff was great, professional, helpful. We had to switch hotels early in the morning because we had to get to a New York Jets game. We thought for sure we would have to store our luggage until we could get in our room, after the game. Much to our surprise they were able to get us into a room, we were so happy. I was also presently surprised to find out they had a free hot breakfast in the morning, bonus. Most things were within walking distance including Times Square. In my opinion a better location than Times Square. Rooms were newer, great beds, good decore, they are small but I have heard that is normal for Manhattan. The first hotel had bigger rooms but it was a dive compared to Hotel 36. I'll take the smaller room any day. Bathrooms were spacious. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent location with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PSUFAN05
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel about three days before our trip to NYC. The price was the best for a 4 star rated hotel on travelocity given the location (200 bucks). It was a good location for us as we arrived by train and was about 3 blocks from Penn Station. It is about 10 blocks from times square and 14 from the theatre district, but all walkable. The hotel rooms were small, but clean. We stayed on the third floor and could hear some street noise but it wasn't enough to keep us awake. The hotel had a breakfast including omlets, sausage, french toast sticks, bagels, yougurt, orange juice, coffee and milk. It is best to get to breakfast earlier rather than later as it did seem the food got eaten and though would get replenished, took a while. The staff was nice, and held our bags the entire day we checked out before our train left. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in New York City”
Reviews.Author: ScottishDreamTours
Reviews.Content: From the wonderful greeting upon arrival to our checkout time we felt very satisfied. We thought the location was perfect being just a short walk from Times Square. We were very pleased that breakfast, morning newspaper and in room internet were all complimentary! The best part of course, was the price considering that we were in the heart of the city. Our room was on the smaller side but we felt this was a wonderful compromise due to everything that we had included and the location. All of the staff were exceptional and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: hotel1991
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice! Looked great and hotel was very clean. I found it odd that in the mornings hotel staff didn't always give guests priority on the elevators(seemed like they thought they deserved the elevator more). I have worked and stayed in many hotels and guests should ALWAYS come first no matter what. Overall I would gladly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Most quiet hotel I have stayed in New York”
Reviews.Author: C-Stop
Reviews.Content: We did request a room on the rear of the hotel, as suggested by prior reviewer(s). Although not a high floor (6th floor), it was the most quiet hotel room I have ever stayed in in New York City. In fact, my (grown) children said it was too quiet, if that's imaginable in NYC. Great location on 36th Street between 8th and 9th Avenues - close walking distance to Penn Station/MSG and the subway (A,C,E,1,2,3 trains). Also had the best (free) breakfast that I have had at a NYC hotel. Free wi-fi and flat panel TV (37"?) in the room. Exceptionally comfortable beds/pillows and exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Hesitate !!”
Reviews.Author: rooneyfamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 2nd Dec 2011, as part of a group of 7 (mixed ages 14-60). We stayed for 3 nights. From the reviews and when we heard management had changed we considered cancelling, but can I just say there is absolutely no reason to be hesitant. On arrival we were greeted by the front house staff, and from that moment everything was first class. Free Wi-Fi, beds to die for, and Free breakfast ! Staff went above and beyond the call of duty for our every request. Maribel helped us make phone calls, Porter was so helpful and friendly, and Jeff gave us lots of advice on places to visit. They really are fantastic. Bathrooms were so clean, beds were spotless, we really can't find one fault with anything. We will rebook for next year too ! Well done to all at Hotel 36.

Reviews.Title: “Nice NYC Hotel close to Times Square and subways”
Reviews.Author: Angie0531
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when visiting NYC for a concert. We weren't expecting a 4star hotel but were pleasantly surprised. We had a slight issue when trying to check in at 2:45 (just 15 minutes before 3) and were declined. Then we had been given a room at 3 and when we got to the room, the bed had not been made and there were wet towels hanging up. We immediately went back to the front desk and they gave us another room on a higher level...definitely worth the inconvenience.The hotel offers a continental breakfast. The room was spotlessly clean and had a pretty decent view of the NYC buildings nearby. The windows were nice and big and even opened for a little fresh fall air breeze. The beds were extremely comfortable and cozy I did not even want to get out of it. The hotel even provided Bath & Body Works products and offered things you might have left at home. The location is close to 34th street, MSG, and a short walk to Times Square. We had a great night here at the Wyndham Garden and would definitely recommend it to other people. Also this hotel is now named "Hotel 36", it has recently been sold from Wyndam, even though there are still Wyndham signs in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: KateMMac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I thought I was getting. I would say I was pleasantly surprised, even. Booked this hotel for a conference that was held at the Javitts Center, which is a few blocks away. The conference suggested hotels were going for nearly $500 a night so this seemed like a steal for less than $300. This area of NYC is not the best for entertainment, but I always felt safe and it's also walking distance from Penn Station and Times Square. The room was spotless and well maintained. I loved the large TV. The rooms are small, but that's what you get in NYC. They included breakfast consisted of your choice of breakfast bread (danish, bagel, or packaged crossiont), a fruit, and coffee or tea. Considering I didn't know there was included breakfast, this was fine with me. The concerige was helpful. The only complaint I have is that you can wait for the elevators for awhile since it's such a tall building (23+ floors).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Javits”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier247
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel in NYC for a business trip this past weekend. I was attending the IHMRS at the Javits Center and picked this property do to their price and location to the convention center. Just a few short blocks to the convention center and a few short blocks the other way to time square. Staff was friendly, rooms were decent size for NYC and EXTREMELY clean. No complaints, would easily recommend this hotel to friends and family. I will stay here next year for the conference as well. Thanks for the great stay Wyndham!

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree By Hilton - Times Square South
HotelInfo.Address: 341 West 36th Street, New York City, NY 10018 (Formerly Hotel 36)
